intro: Achyranthes mutica, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
